website_summaries.verdict: If you don't have the need to produce large volumes and prefer a manual model, this is a solid deal.
pros: A manual model that is both affordable and easy to use for most consumers
Sports a durable cast iron build and well-made components including the easy-to-secure clamp
Original corn mill that's been manufactured by Victoria since 1962
cons: Though it's not practical for grinding large volumes quickly, if you have the time and strength it will accomplish numerous grinding jobs from fine to coarse

customer_reviews.title: Won't grind fine enough to produce pastry flour
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do, and does it well. Won't grind fine enough to produce pastry flour, but it's great for tortillas and such. If you want to stop the little bits of metal people have complained about, just grind a cup of dried pinto beans when you first get it. They will clean everything out and it will work perfectly afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Best corn grinder around
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hand grinder for making dry corn meal or corn masa. I have a grain mill attachment for our Kitchen Aid mixer but this Victoria manual grinder runs circles around the Kitchen Aid. It takes a 10th of the time to grind the same amount of meal using this grinder. It is well made and easy to adjust...and inexpensive compared to other options. All and all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Kilgo

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to mount onto a surface and still grind into ...
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to mount onto a surface and still grind into a 5 gallon bucket. Item is not returnable which is BS ***update*** Amazon made it right and helped me get a refund on this item. They went above and beyond to make it right. Product still isn't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability of milling coarseness is questionable (at best..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to mill grains for beer brewing. Just returned it. Adjustability of milling coarseness is questionable (at best...). Also, the grinding disks seem to be made of the same metal (plated iron?) that the body is made of. Given that the plates run against each other, I wonder how much metal you grind into your grain. I also had a nasty surprise when trying to return it, getting a non-refundable item notice. This was made clear when I purchased the mill. Kudos to Amazon for issuing a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rami S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is a beast (and I mean that in a good way.) It is solid, easy to assemble and disassemble, and is great for my needs (beer making). The grind adjustments are OK and simple. You will get a workout with the hand crank. If you have kids this would be the perfect opportunity for you to Tom Sawyer them into believing hand grinding is better than X-Box. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin B.

customer_reviews.title: Metal shavings in ground food.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, even after cleaning it 3 times, and I mean scrubbing it with soap and hot water, it still had a sticky film to it. Then when I was grinding there were metal flakes in the horseradish I was grinding. Even after adjusting the grinding wheels I kept getting metal in my horseradish. I was very disappointed and would gladly have returned it except I didn't get to use it till 3 days after the "return by this date".
customer_reviews.author: katsher

customer_reviews.title: Suggestions included in review. Heavy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one before my husband and son got the bright idea to try to hook it up to a drill to make it electric. Was a different brand. Got this for a gift! These things take muscle and patience but work for off grid and the parts are cast metal. When you wash it...make sure it is dried and parts are disassembled until all moisture is gone. The clamps will damage counters so keep that in mind. Most the time I used a toothbrush to clean mine as I used it so much. Coffee, nuts, mash, peanut butter, wheat berries and etc! These are awesome! This one is HEAVY!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried one of these from another brand and was not impressed. This was not the case. The casting seemed much better than other brands and the tin coating seems well done and not flaky or cheap. I had purchased it to grind coffee in bulk (my electric grinders overheat) and the one small batch went through great. I had also tried some cheap dried beans (this was a little tougher to turn) to test and break in the grinding plates with no issues. I ran a magnet through everything and found no bits of metal. So far, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money with this product flakes of metal are coming out when I was grinding, is so dangerous, I was grinding fresh corn, all the fluids came out the grinder making a mess all around. the sad part is a did not use it during the return period and now I can not return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mireya calderon

customer_reviews.title: Off gridders?? Survivalists??? Or simply those who want a mill that I expect to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty, Adjustable grind from fine to course. NOT a piece of aluminum junk!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Hopper falls off very easily
customer_reviews.text: This grain mill is awesome and is very easy to use. The only thing we do not like is that the hopper falls off incredibly easily as there is no way to lock it in place. We think this is a defect in the product and that it needs to be fixed
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Z.

customer_reviews.title: Does not grind flour.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was a grain mill. It is not. It can grind coffee and maybe corn but it will not grind grain into flour. I even tried tightening it as much as I could and it still wouldn't grind flour. I ran it through 4 times and it's still not ground enough for flour. I ended up tightening it so much that it broke. So much for it being cast iron. What a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for making fresh corn masa!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder for grinding nixmalitized corn (it's intended purpose) and what I wanted for. Though I'm sure it will work for other purposes as well. It took some practice but I was able to get it adjusted fine enough not to have to process the corn through more than once. Made some great fresh corn tortillas!
customer_reviews.author: BHuginn

customer_reviews.title: Corn Grinder
customer_reviews.text: my husband received this yesterday and put it together without much trouble. the hopper would not fit on the mill without some modification with a pair of plier, but other than that all was good. it will hold about three cups of corn and will grind it to what ever fineness he needs with one grinding. it will need to be fixed permanently to a workstation with bolts. the thing wobbles so bad you can't use it just using the little table clamps. Overall though he is happy with it and is probably already grinding his corn.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality , I’ve been a loyal customer for years now because my grandma loves this company, but I was disappointed after it broke so quickly after purchase, I will not be buying anymore
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy or durable, breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my parents/household to grind spices and it broke after one use. It honestly didn’t even grind all that good and I would expect it to last a little longer/grind very easily considering it was a little pricy and “commercial grade”
customer_reviews.author: Erika P

customer_reviews.title: Good - but could be better - Wheat grinder
customer_reviews.text: Better design than my previous grinder - but difficult to hook to the table/counter. If it was extended on the counter attachment it would be much better. There's also a rubber stopper on the attachment - but a second one (on the other side of the attachment) would be even better. That - and extending it a little further.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Walker

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useless
customer_reviews.text: What exactly is this for? After multiple runs on the finest setting it produces rough grind grains. I can put in the same physical effort into a mortar and pestle and get identical results for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make masa and it worked just as expected. Easy to put together and after running the corn through twice it made great tortillas and tamales. I ground 10lbs of corn.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Strong but molds too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed of the quality of this grinder. I changed my review from a 5 to a 3 because we washed it the night before we used it for the very first time and in the morning it has mold all over. Every single part had mold, so I was very disappointed. If you buy this grinder you have to dry it out the minute you wash it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Giraldo

customer_reviews.title: I’m very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The cup is crushed, it looks like is used. The smell is unbearable!.. any way, I don’t want to buy this kind of thing by Amazon, because they always send things are already used, scratched, or broken
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well if you put some muscle to it and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well if you put some muscle to it and I usually have to grind more than once to get a finer product. My main complaint is that occasionally the metal flakes into my grain. The more I use it the less it happens.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not HAPPY!
customer_reviews.text: MY packaged arrived. Outside box intact unlike the product itself! Plasric bag it was in was greasy..... I looked in. The hopper and it was dented and greasy like it HAS been USED! Im am LIVID! THIS IS GOING BACK AND I WILL NEVER REORDER FROM THIS PLACE EVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Jean E.

customer_reviews.title: Pre-grind for cocoa nibs is no problem
customer_reviews.text: Before adding nibs to a melanger, I had used a Champion Juicer to pre-grind. Fearing that I might burn out the juicer, I looked for alternatives. The hand powered grain mill works well and does not generate heat. The nibs do not release the cocoa butter, so the pre-grind is dry and easy to transfer to malanger without material loss.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Improperly described
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a GRAIN MILL. instead the box says CORN MILL. Not the same thing... I'm not making chicken feed.
customer_reviews.author: SlyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Rusts
customer_reviews.text: This thing rusts immediately after washing it the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Pete M.

customer_reviews.title: Victoria Commercial Grade Manual Grain Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it to grind grains for brewing. Easily adjustable and simple to use. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: gizmoli

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but no instructions to put it together
customer_reviews.text: Overall the grinder is great! I grinded some pinto beans to see how good it would work, it worked good. It was a fine powder. I was a little disappointed because there were no instruction to help you put it together. The pictures on the box were the only instruction. It wasn't to hard to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Napoli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product and Value
customer_reviews.text: This grain grinder is an excellent product, very well-made and easy to use. It comes mostly assembled with all the parts needed to complete the assembly. This is my dedicated grinder for making homemade peanut butter!
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Sent it to the Carribean and just finished grinding corn with it when we got here No problems .
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN G

customer_reviews.title: Its a good work out
customer_reviews.text: works as it is supposed to. grinds corn down to powder, and it does a lot at a time. Its a good work out, and I am currently in search of either a motor or an attachment for a drill. Good Product!!!
customer_reviews.author: robert gerholdt

customer_reviews.title: Works very good for milling grains
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to make beer at home. Works very good for milling grains. I've had no problems with it and it's built to last. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kylan St.Jean

customer_reviews.title: Quality Mill.
customer_reviews.text: Mill works good , takes some effort to turn handle if on first grind you set it very fine. Best to grind you corn or beans twice . Well made product!
customer_reviews.author: Maya Lama

customer_reviews.title: Grinder
customer_reviews.text: We use this grinder to grind corn for our chickens
customer_reviews.author: Vikena G Thigpen

customer_reviews.title: Does OK
customer_reviews.text: It works good but it's hard to crank but all in all it's all right
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grain mill
customer_reviews.text: This mill is everything I'd hoped for. Very heavy construction, ease of assembly and use. Should have bought it much sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Flour spills out between the funnel and the crank, also comes out the back of the crank.
customer_reviews.text: because there is no solid seal for this product flour comes out all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. Easy to clean. Would recommend and will buy again if needed
customer_reviews.author: sarah s.

customer_reviews.title: worked great would buy again if needed not made from the ...
customer_reviews.text: worked great would buy again if needed not made from the best of material, but for the price,it will do in emergency. Cheap cast or white metal, very fragile
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: there will be metal shavings on the finest setting the first couple of times you use this
customer_reviews.text: As said in previous reviews, there will be metal shavings on the finest setting the first couple of times you use this. Just run a magnet through the product and all is good. To get a finer meal run it through twice. To be honest, I'm very impressed with the quality and performance of the product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WAY TO CRUSH CORN AND SUNFLOWER SEEDS OF OUR ...
customer_reviews.text: GREAT WAY TO CRUSH CORN AND SUNFLOWER SEEDS OF OUR CHICKENS. WE SAVE MONEY BY BUYING CORN AND SUNFLOWERS IN BULK.
customer_reviews.author: gatorgirl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Using to grind grain for chicken feed
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Wenner

customer_reviews.title: Servicable, but required modification for homemade tempeh
customer_reviews.text: Required modification to get the plates set right to grind beans for homemade tempeh. It works now, but it did take some work.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Keep a magnet handy
customer_reviews.text: Metal shavings in our wheat is not cool. I have it 3 stars since it works well outside of the metal flakes.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Mike

customer_reviews.title: A classic. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for grinding small amounts of dried corn for household use.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom and by the time she was able to try it out, it didn’t grind the corn fine enough. No matter how she adjusted it. It was too late to return and now we’re stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not all the part came if you look at the picture.
customer_reviews.text: Not all the part came. And I knew this only when I wanted to use it for grinding. I don’t even know what to do at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: rely t

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love my Grinder. Some of my family saw me using it and will be ordering one too before the holidays
customer_reviews.author: Honest Vic

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grind grain for flour and didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Mill would not grind flour. It made a grinding sound from the adjustment bolt all the way in to all the way out. It didn't work and was defective upon reciept.
customer_reviews.author: John Cheroki

customer_reviews.title: Misaligned grinding plate
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this item 6/28/2015, the grinding plate is mounted crooked on the auger shaft making grinding rate vary per 360 degree revolution, you get too fine a grind and then no grinding with the misaligned plate. It is unusable for grinding anything with precision. I will be returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Foley

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! Received product missing multiple parts. Could not even assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Ngozi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: You must use it a few times to get the hang of it, but performed as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used it for corn and wheat. Is adjustable for the result I desire.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A

customer_reviews.title: Household use only.
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job, just don't expect it will be super fast, or handle large amounts quickly. Works quite well for small household use.
customer_reviews.author: deb46

customer_reviews.title: Avoif
customer_reviews.text: Avoid. Heavy, clunky, loose fitting parts. Not a refined product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: barley mashing
customer_reviews.text: Works well on barley. Sturdy too. I use mine for beer mash. The first handful will need to be run thru again until auger primes.
customer_reviews.author: john p.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, My VITA MIX works better with less hassle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check product
customer_reviews.text: Product hopper arrived with a decent dent, but other than that it grinds corn great
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Wilson

customer_reviews.title: difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: It comes apart easily. I wasted more that a pound of beans while using it. Wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: barb

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to roughly grind whole grains for my chickens. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: It’s nice quality. It’s heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Very use full. Nice and sturdy. Grinds corn very good. I mean you can change the setting to grind as fine or as little as u would like.
customer_reviews.author: yoselin

customer_reviews.title: which easily ground cracked dent corn into a
customer_reviews.text: A grinder that is built to last, which easily ground cracked dent corn into corn meal such as you would buy at the grocery. I am 71 and suffer from carpal tunnel, but found it this grinder fairly easy to operate. A little bit of a workout, but nothing major. In my test, I turned out four ounces of corn meal in less than five minutes. Easy to disassemble for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Harold H.

customer_reviews.title: Vvvvv
customer_reviews.text: Will not make cornmeal, too crude, only good for rough brain busting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look  Elsewhere !
customer_reviews.text: Received our grain mill today, damaged from the factory, as the package was intact and free of damage, there is also notable spot of rust
customer_reviews.author: Paul E.

customer_reviews.title: Wifey loves it. !
customer_reviews.text: Nice lil machine. Wifey can spend spare time cooking goods for our lil ones. Thanks for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: El choko

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought for prepping stocks..used once and it functioned as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: It broke after return period expired
customer_reviews.text: A piece broke off while grinding nixtamalized corn. I dont know if it was dropped during shipping or just brittle from factory. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D val

customer_reviews.title: A breeze to use.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ease of use and easy to assemble. High quality design.
customer_reviews.author: Isai Navarrete

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I use it to grind corn. It seems to be solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Peden

customer_reviews.title: didnt grind flour or corn perfectly
customer_reviews.text: the flour wasn't ground fine enough neither was the corn
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to assemble but can’t grind corn smoothly as described. I am returning this device back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works great. It's a good workout for your arms.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Star Dad

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to assemble. Heavy duty and seems hard to damage. Bolt can be adjusted to change grain size.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Rusts easy, metal flakes off
customer_reviews.text: Rusts easy, metal flakes off. It worked but I would get s different Me if I could go it agsin
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't grind as fine as I was expecting, even after running it through multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Did a very good job of grinding fresh corn. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great item works well for the money. You will need something very sturdy and heavy to clamp iit to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damage
customer_reviews.text: I received two Victoria grade and both were damage why?
customer_reviews.author: R.Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Picture is not the same as the product.
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows the hopper guard as being metal. The one I received had a black plastic guard which is not as strong as a metal one. If you look at the other Victoria grinders, you can definately tell a black plastic guard from a metal guard. This picture shows a metal guard. Not a huge deal but it was a factor in choosing this model versus the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: nice entry for the price
customer_reviews.text: use it everyday for grinding course flour to add to bread, nice entry for the price, only issue i have is how to mount to counter, had to use wood screws to keep it from moving
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Meyer

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: great mill, it does exactly as I expected. Now I can make my Panamanian empanadas the way I have them back home
customer_reviews.author: Liliana

customer_reviews.title: Home brewers take note
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed for crushing whole grains. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Use to grind my coffee almost everyday. Consistent coarse every time
customer_reviews.author: Uziel Urias

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product. Works well and very easy to assemble. Product arrived at a good time also. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Ahntakmetak

customer_reviews.title: Item was easy to assemble and is very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Item was easy to assemble and is very heavy duty. Make sure to dry thoroughly as rust can occur easily
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Fully adjustable high quality mill
customer_reviews.text: This mill is awesome. The moment you pick it up you realize that this thing is built to last. The grinding mechanism is fully adjustable and has a very wide range which is perfect since I use it to make homemade flour as well as for homebrewing beer. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: OMG, immediately after taking this out of the box the strong chemical smell was overpowering. It appears this mill is spray painted with a silver paint and I would never be able to process my food with this product. I can't imagine how this product could be food safe, must be made in China. I put it back in the box, it is going back today!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used it to grind cooked hominy corn for arepas. The metal started to get rusted after just one use and wash. I don't think I will be using this again. What a waste of money, time and effort. I am truly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grinder for the money! Corn does NOT splash out the top as some feedbacks suggested. I'm using it for grinding corn for my chickens, and am planning on adding a motor to it. In the meantime, just enjoying the workout. I haven't tried making it into flour, but feel it would do a GREAT job by tightening the knob and running it through a couple of times. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my son. He likes to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. He likes to grind corn to feed to our ducks. This is a little powerhouse and has held up well. Especially since a 10 year old is running it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. I used it to grind cocoa beans and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I used it to grind cocoa beans and it was very good for that. Haven't tried anything else.
customer_reviews.author: E. Overstall

customer_reviews.title: I like it , works great
customer_reviews.text: great product, works great, easy to use, worth the money, packaged properly and on time delivery. I would definitely make this purchase again if needed
customer_reviews.author: Capt Jim

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for grinding my own gluten free flour!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to grind gluten free flour for my husband. This is a fabulous product & nice to have on hand! So gland I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Cajundiva

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once, but it worked great for grinding corn. I'm fairly DIY oriented and was able to assemble the grinder when I received it. This comes from Columbia and the limited instructions are in Spanish. This might make it a little difficult for those who aren't DIY oriented. That's the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: MIssing Part!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received it on time and the grinder is exactly what I expected! My complaint is that the crank screw was not int the box and the product box was opened inside the shipping box with parts everywhere. The shipping box was damaged I imagine that the crank screw fell out of a hole in the bottom of it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I use it to make powder from dehydrated ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I use it to make powder from dehydrated pumpkins, sweet potato and butternut squash. I was a little bummed it came to me with a bit of rust on it but it's only on the exterior not anywhere that the stuff I'm grinding would come in contact with.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh E.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice grinder for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not finely polished, but very functional. Did a great job with field corn to produce a nice quality corn meal.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Heintzelman

customer_reviews.title: Only cracks corn, doesn't grind it into corn meal ...
customer_reviews.text: Only cracks corn, doesn't grind it into corn meal It is too far apart to make meal, may try to alter it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J Wood

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and just what I wanted. Well built and simple to assemble. Only one thing I have not been able to do on the assembly. The plastic shield (see photo) is very brittle and virtually impossible to put on without fear of breaking so I have not bothered. Actually I am not sure exactly how it is supposed to fit so would like some help with that. Other than that I am fully satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: DMAdam47

customer_reviews.title: No red grind cover.
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with the red grind cover. One of reasons I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: GaryLeePerry

product_meta.title: Victoria Cast Iron Manual Grain Mill. Manual Coffee Grinder, Corn Mill, Seed Grinder with Low Hopper. Table Clamp
product_meta.description: Size:LowGrind it, prepare it, cook it. It's manual-attic! time for some real, authentic tortillas and breads - really made from scratch. You can use the Victoria manually operated low hopper grain grinder as a coffee grinder, pepper grinder, spice grinder, rice grinder, nuts grinder, wheat, oats, barley, rye grinder and much more. Clamps to most tables and has a conventional screw for easy milling. From coarse to fine, Victoria kitchen grain grinder is perfect for green, zero waste,and all-natural everyday use or emergencies.
feature_bullets: ✔️ Adjustable. You can adjust the coarseness and fineness of your milling using the adjusting screw.
✔️ Do it yourself. You will find pleasure in the tactile experience of grinding your coffee, making tortillas, peanut butter bread and more from scratch.

✔️Heavy-duty construction. Made of Cast-iron with sanitary double-tin plating to resist stains and corrosion, compliant with international regulations. High performance discs are made of anti-erosion white iron for maximum durability and performance on all types of grain.
✔️Grind Anything! Use it for home brewing, corn, barley, grains, Coffee, cheese, vegetables, seeds, nuts, coconut, spices, dried beans, cooked meats, etc.

✔️Capacity of adjustment. The clamp is easily adjustable to most tables and boards 1/2” to 2” thick. Comes with a protective non-slip rubber, protects your surfaces and prevents the grain grinder from slipping in heavy work
